commit_message:
Don't validate address when using get_attr

We added bunch of validations for address property of monasca
notification resource. However, this would not work when we
use 'get_attr' with another resource(yet to be created), that
returns None.

Change-Id: Ic457ce343916e6a664dcfb497b42eaf47036b8b3
Closes-Bug: #1646633

commit_message:
Auto enable the deploy driver

This will reduce misconfiguration as if the user forgets to
include its driver in the enabled driver, the stack will fail.

Partial-bug: #1633567

subject: Fix import method to follow community guideline
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-02 02:12:35.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/drac/inspect.py'], 'message': 'Fix import method to follow community guideline

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as community guideline [1].
[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

Change-Id: I6c49be4f26b9be39972f5aa65240e94dee838e2d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix import method to follow community guideline

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as community guideline [1].
[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

Change-Id: I6c49be4f26b9be39972f5aa65240e94dee838e2d

subject: test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 08:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used to cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync, nothing uses the provisioning system. The
engine can be created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

This change restore the previous assumption that expected self.db to
point to the current database object.

Change-Id: I8aa75b5c982100497a809c755585c9a5e11773de
Closes-bug: #1647280
'}]
commit_message:
test_migration: use correct backend for cleanup

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used to cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync, nothing uses the provisioning system. The
engine can be created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

This change restore the previous assumption that expected self.db to
point to the current database object.

Change-Id: I8aa75b5c982100497a809c755585c9a5e11773de
Closes-bug: #1647280

commit_message:
Force scala 2.11.6 for Ubuntu Trusty

The newer deb from scala-project.org (2.12.0, and probably the future ones)
depends on openjdk-8 which is only available on xenial.

Closes-Bug: #1644799
Change-Id: I3300bdc37f8da5b803ed2f311e39fe305b15d269
(cherry picked from commit bdd0c5c61d0edc5d1f6f4124469bf41eb2a746b2)

commit_message:
Force scala 2.11.6 for Ubuntu Trusty

The newer deb from scala-project.org (2.12.0, and probably the future ones)
depends on openjdk-8 which is only available on xenial.

(cherry picked from commit bdd0c5c61d0edc5d1f6f4124469bf41eb2a746b2)

commit_message:
Add project_id_param variable

In CredClients class, self.project_id_param is used as no defined.
We should declare this variable to make the code more intuitive.
We can add project_id_param = 'tenantId' or
project_id_param = 'project_id', the two are same as it will be
covered in sub class.

Change-Id: Idf7a04e93e357c48f60b35b3753e26c66e76499f

commit_message:
Turn off tempest's multitenant network tests

This disables the multitenant networking tests that come from tempest's
tree, but not the ones in ironic's tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I62cc4ae3e9fe7dc63ec4373535fe6ae07084a381

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-11-28 16:32:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py'], 'message': 'Introduce objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py

This patch introduces objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py.

The purpose of this patch: During OVO integration, there are
instances where we need to check whether an object is present
or not. Instead of writing custom methods based on get_objects,
this objects_exist method can be used.

Change-Id: I2546c31ef4a81c1e34dfaade97f93407910e0985
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py

This patch introduces objects_exist method in neutron/objects/base.py.

The purpose of this patch: During OVO integration, there are
instances where we need to check whether an object is present
or not. Instead of writing custom methods based on get_objects,
this objects_exist method can be used.

Change-Id: I2546c31ef4a81c1e34dfaade97f93407910e0985
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Remove unused trusty jobs

Some repos like inception, i18n, intel-nfv-ci-tests, kwapi,
manila-image-elements and others have no stable
branches. Thus these repositories will never run the trusty jobs.

Remove these extra unused jobs.

Change-Id: I22953aee080ec9da07d689e1deca7fdcd0e4536f

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 02:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/generate_validations_doc.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib0b94e13c0f3cfebe5ce84dfadd850d0143b2de5
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib0b94e13c0f3cfebe5ce84dfadd850d0143b2de5

commit_message:
Fix duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: I6f437550edd78af372e5f52b55663beab86edfee
Closes-Bug: #1636472

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-23 08:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/generate.py', 'lib/filesystem.py', 'lib/manage.py', 'tests/test_filesystem.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Inventory refactor SystemExit uses removed

The use of SystemExit exceptions in what is effectively library code
has been eliminated. A new exception is introduced and it is handled
with a translation to a SystemExit within generate.py when
appropriate.

When attempting to load an existing inventory, a tuple is returned
instead of simply the inventory. The tuple includes the path used to
load the inventory, or an appropriate path. This facilitates saving
to the correct place with save_inventory later.

Use of dir_find within generate.py was also eliminated and the logic
around path to configuration should be simpler now.

One debug logging message was adjusted to only run when the desired
file is actually loaded, where it was always trying to log a message
even if not file was found previously.

The manage.py file had imports updated to replicate the pattern used
in generate.py

Change-Id: I9caecfa09517a508882ae491df9e3d2da9386012
Parent-Id: I577cdbf4aadfcce846412edd7e2a394c257c0243
'}]
commit_message:
Inventory refactor SystemExit uses removed

The use of SystemExit exceptions in what is effectively library code
has been eliminated. A new exception is introduced and it is handled
with a translation to a SystemExit within generate.py when
appropriate.

When attempting to load an existing inventory, a tuple is returned
instead of simply the inventory. The tuple includes the path used to
load the inventory, or an appropriate path. This facilitates saving
to the correct place with save_inventory later.

Use of dir_find within generate.py was also eliminated and the logic
around path to configuration should be simpler now.

One debug logging message was adjusted to only run when the desired
file is actually loaded, where it was always trying to log a message
even if not file was found previously.

The manage.py file had imports updated to replicate the pattern used
in generate.py

Change-Id: I9caecfa09517a508882ae491df9e3d2da9386012
Parent-Id: I577cdbf4aadfcce846412edd7e2a394c257c0243

commit_message:
Deal with CONF.config_dir correctly

When config_dir is set, we were seeing this error:
  execv() arg 2 must contain only strings

We got this debug log:
  ['sudo', 'nova-rootwrap', ... ,
  '--config-file', '/nova/nova.conf', '--config-dir', ['/etc/nova'],
  ...]

Change-Id: I592035f7e37adee375f1530d4fbc28107870b089
Closes-Bug: 1616240
(cherry picked from commit 1666d9153a3b064c95e9fcaa6c3d77b926517a9c)

commit_message:
Remove agent vendor passthru from most drivers

This patch removes the deprecated agent lookup/heartbeat as vendor
passthru functionality from most of the drivers in following modules:
- ironic.drivers.agent
- ironic.drivers.pxe
- ironic.drivers.drac
- ironic.drivers.irmc

Some drivers are left untouched though:
- iLO and OneView drivers are a bit more complicated and will be fixed
  in follow-up patches
- iBoot, WoL and AMT drivers will be fixed in ironic-staging-drivers
  repo first and then removed from ironic tree.

Change-Id: Ia9ee46cda68ef823d1fe8e5ea03c1d5948810a50
Partial-Bug: #1640533

commit_message:
Force trusty on Spark, Vanilla and Storm Ubuntu images

The other images (Ambari, CDH, MapR) do not support Xenial.
Spark depends on CDH, and while Vanilla and Storm may support Xenial,
there are other packages and dependencies that need to be fixed first.

Change-Id: Ied720e35d2a5372f228861b104cca1afddaf26f9
(cherry picked from commit 9ac38b939ae8cfea8c2ad62dffce78a1ca0fc2f0)

commit_message:
api-ref: Deprecate the server actions to get consoles in v2.5

The blueprint consolidate-console-api introduced a consolidated REST API
for the different console types RDP, VNC, SERIAL, SPICE. This superseded
the different server actions to get these consoles, therefore they got
deprecated in microversion 2.5. Microversion 2.6 offers then the unified
console API:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_history.html#id5

This change adds the deprecation notes to the server actions.

part of bp:consolidate-console-api

Change-Id: If126791c3efbc9bb820771f84aecbea20ca0b9a1

subject: Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 11:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-versioned-writes-middleware-0b529e3cf2fb493d.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00
'}]
commit_message:
Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00

The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 07:29:32.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Change the oslo vmware requirement

Networking-vSphere requires some changes in oslo vmware which is
available in oslo.vmware 2.15.0 release.

In order to change the Networking-vSphere requirement, we need to change
the openstack global-requirement also to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0 or later
version.

This patch set changes the global-requirement to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0
and later version.

Change-Id: I965e3809cd5f79e47dfa6465081c63dd616d6227
'}]
commit_message:
Change the oslo vmware requirement

Networking-vSphere requires some changes in oslo vmware which is
available in oslo.vmware 2.15.0 release.

In order to change the Networking-vSphere requirement, we need to change
the openstack global-requirement also to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0 or later
version.

This patch set changes the global-requirement to use oslo.vmware 2.15.0
and later version.

Change-Id: I965e3809cd5f79e47dfa6465081c63dd616d6227

Update all SHAs for 13.3.10

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-05 08:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel7stig/auth.yml', 'doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-010373.rst', 'doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-010372.rst', 'templates/pam_faillock.j2', 'doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-010371.rst', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Apply pam_faillock restrictions [+Docs]

This patch applies pam_faillock restrictions to Red Hat and CentOS servers.
It's an optional change since it could cause issues with existing production
deployments.

Ubuntu doesn't have pam_faillock, but it may be possible to use fail2ban to
achieve some of the same goals later.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ib2d22deff2d97786b84a550313f6ca08cf10cef8
"}]
commit_message:
Apply pam_faillock restrictions [+Docs]

This patch applies pam_faillock restrictions to Red Hat and CentOS servers.
It's an optional change since it could cause issues with existing production
deployments.

Ubuntu doesn't have pam_faillock, but it may be possible to use fail2ban to
achieve some of the same goals later.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ib2d22deff2d97786b84a550313f6ca08cf10cef8

subject: Add alt text for badges
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 16:23:49.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': "Add alt text for badges

The RST image directive takes an alt parameter that's used to supply an
alt attribute for the HTML image element that's generated during RST
to HTML conversion.  The alt text is useful for accessibility purposes
and is also displayed if the image source is unavailable when the HTML
is generated.  Because of the latter point, we can't rely on the
accessibility features of the SVG image, we need to maintain some info
here in the README.rst file.

Change-Id: I598a99237b8581995e79be96172a42a752107357
"}]
commit_message:
Add alt text for badges

The RST image directive takes an alt parameter that's used to supply an
alt attribute for the HTML image element that's generated during RST
to HTML conversion.  The alt text is useful for accessibility purposes
and is also displayed if the image source is unavailable when the HTML
is generated.  Because of the latter point, we can't rely on the
accessibility features of the SVG image, we need to maintain some info
here in the README.rst file.

Change-Id: I598a99237b8581995e79be96172a42a752107357

subject: Update vmware_nsx version to 0.4.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 06:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Update vmware_nsx version to 0.4.0

The version contains the following bug fixes:
1. Ensure that target type is configurable for exclude list
2. Support paginated responses from the NSX
3. Add support for firewall exclude list
4. Ensure that correct exception is raised
5. Fix router name update

Change-Id: I5d5f92cbe19ba94d390c6fecbff1ae2083231657
'}]
commit_message:
Update vmware_nsx version to 0.4.0

The version contains the following bug fixes:
1. Ensure that target type is configurable for exclude list
2. Support paginated responses from the NSX
3. Add support for firewall exclude list
4. Ensure that correct exception is raised
5. Fix router name update

Change-Id: I5d5f92cbe19ba94d390c6fecbff1ae2083231657

Use fake uuid for uuid field in unit test

is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields with invalid UUIDs is
no longer supported in the unit test result

Angularize node tables

This patch implements node table and detail page based on AngularJS.
As a related patch, I'll implement create/update/delete actions.

Partial-Implements: blueprint angularize-node-table

commit_message:
ITRI DISCO cinder backup driver

This commit adds a Cinder backup driver for ITRI DISCO product.

The DISCO backup driver supports the following features:

* Backup any volume from any drivers to DISCO backend
* It will be incremental backup if it is a backup of a DISCO volume
* Restore a backup from DISCO storage system

It also includes the unit tests.

DocImpact

commit_message:
[WIP]Report IPv4 capabilities for IP drivers

Please read spec for design detail:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362786/

The patch list:
    1. Support IPv6 in allow_access&dummy,generic driver(312321)
    2. Report IPv4 capability in current drivers(this)
    3. Support IPv6 in huawei driver
    4. Support in manilaclient(328932)
    5. Seneraio tests
    6. Documentation

Change-Id: I163372b2ea6336b901856083b48579fcab4d75cd

subject: Add pip and virtualenv upgrade to development guidelines
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-24 11:44:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/development_guidelines.rst'], 'message': 'Add pip and virtualenv upgrade to development guidelines

Change [1] requires pip >= 7.0.1. In general, test
environments will need to have pip and virtualenv in line
with global requirements. Add a reference to the global
requirements rather than specifying versions that will
inevitably become stale.

Also adds inline literal markup to all occurences of "tox"
for consistency.

[1] Related-Change: I7c60be623b4340ee34ae1aa520f17b303348811d

Change-Id: I7730f22c594a3521973cb9ff264a7d50f2b86a1a
Depends-On: I45eee626713438af5fc676f2b5f636d7ec23f7be
'}]
commit_message:
Add pip and virtualenv upgrade to development guidelines

Change [1] requires pip >= 7.0.1. In general, test
environments will need to have pip and virtualenv in line
with global requirements. Add a reference to the global
requirements rather than specifying versions that will
inevitably become stale.

Also adds inline literal markup to all occurences of "tox"
for consistency.

[1] Related-Change: I7c60be623b4340ee34ae1aa520f17b303348811d

Change-Id: I7730f22c594a3521973cb9ff264a7d50f2b86a1a
Depends-On: I45eee626713438af5fc676f2b5f636d7ec23f7be

commit_message:
Fixed job match pattern for skipping non-doc jobs for neutron-lib

Now that neutron-lib gate jobs have the -ubuntu-* ending, the old
pattern was not matching properly.

This can be observed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404933/

Fixed it by allowing for -ubuntu-[trusty|xenial] ending.

Change-Id: I380edce8bdd4bf767cb753adc03b09c741f4cecb

commit_message:
networking-odl: remove periodic tempest liberty job

It turned out that
periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-{beryllium, boron}-snapshot-liberty
fail to run test. Since stable/liberty branch is about to be end of
life, there is no point to fix it, but remove those periodic jobs.
note: periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-boron-snapshot-mitaka
is able to run test and failed with some test cases.
It's another story to address it and to add new periodic jobs
with newton branch + new ODL version.

Change-Id: I5587f97a4b893c84492d01fe7f5d3efd068b41ab

commit_message:
remove django-openstack-auth-kerberos from infra

doa-kerb is being retired. it was untested, unmaintained and has
two point releases. Following the instruction at [1], the repo
now contains only a REAMDE.rst file [2].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#remove-project-from-infrastructure-systems
[2] https://github.com/openstack/django-openstack-auth-kerberos

Change-Id: I17374b3c846570c15066ac6575f63a3fdadb8f24
Needed-By: I4e09fc2fa0888334e1ec90b1829eb0c065f79bb3
Related-Bug: 1584432

subject: Add TripleO CI scenarios to Puppet gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-03 21:09:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add TripleO CI scenarios to Puppet gate

We tested TripleO CI scenario001 and scenario004 in puppet-ceph gate and
it works fine. This patch completes the work with other modules:

- Add scenario00(2,3)-multinode-puppet jobs in
  jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml.
- Create Zuul Layout for tripleo-scenario-jobs-scenario00(2,3) groups of
  jobs.
- tripleo scenario001 will be run for puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer,
  puppet-gnocchi and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario002 will be run for puppet-barbican, puppet-swift,
  puppet-zaqar and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario003 will be run for puppet-sahara, puppet-mistral and
  puppet-horizon.
- puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer, puppet-cinder, won't run
  tripleo-puppet-jobs layout anymore but it's on purpose.
- puppet-cinder will run tripleo ovb jobs for newton and mitaka only
  and scenario001 and 002 in ocata.

This patch is part of the efforts made in TripleO CI to have scenarios,
like we already have in Puppet CI. We also made our best to build
similar scenarios between TripleO and Puppet CIs, to bring consistency
in our tests.

Change-Id: I9af581195d1872cb5fd6f06802d6b8940e66645e
"}]
commit_message:
Add TripleO CI scenarios to Puppet gate

We tested TripleO CI scenario001 and scenario004 in puppet-ceph gate and
it works fine. This patch completes the work with other modules:

- Add scenario00(2,3)-multinode-puppet jobs in
  jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml.
- Create Zuul Layout for tripleo-scenario-jobs-scenario00(2,3) groups of
  jobs.
- tripleo scenario001 will be run for puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer,
  puppet-gnocchi and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario002 will be run for puppet-barbican, puppet-swift,
  puppet-zaqar and puppet-cinder.
- tripleo scenario003 will be run for puppet-sahara, puppet-mistral and
  puppet-horizon.
- puppet-aodh, puppet-ceilometer, puppet-cinder, won't run
  tripleo-puppet-jobs layout anymore but it's on purpose.
- puppet-cinder will run tripleo ovb jobs for newton and mitaka only
  and scenario001 and 002 in ocata.

This patch is part of the efforts made in TripleO CI to have scenarios,
like we already have in Puppet CI. We also made our best to build
similar scenarios between TripleO and Puppet CIs, to bring consistency
in our tests.

Change-Id: I9af581195d1872cb5fd6f06802d6b8940e66645e

subject: ovs-agent: Close ryu app on all exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 13:20:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/ovs_ryuapp.py'], 'message': "ovs-agent: Close ryu app on all exceptions

Previous patch closes app only when ovs-agent raises an exception. This
leaves some corner cases where exceptions inheriting from BaseException
are raised. It's better to be defensive and always close app on error.

Change-Id: Icaaaecc4d00e3a280c3af2e403499bb7ac9e8aa6
Related-bug: 1611237
"}]
commit_message:
ovs-agent: Close ryu app on all exceptions

Previous patch closes app only when ovs-agent raises an exception. This
leaves some corner cases where exceptions inheriting from BaseException
are raised. It's better to be defensive and always close app on error.

Change-Id: Icaaaecc4d00e3a280c3af2e403499bb7ac9e8aa6
Related-bug: 1611237

commit_message:
Warn user if types using es to reindex don't exist

If user specifies --type parameter in index syncing, this will
cause resource types that are explicit specified on the command
line are indexed in ElasticSearch through the associated plugin
making API calls. There is a possibility that old indices or
type mappings are not exist, reindexing these types from es
will result in incomplete index. Add check and
warning for users.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I8cd18aa0fa208a91e0b254ed2945923b4d9fa17a
Closes-Bug: #1596710

commit_message:
Get rid of DVR inheritance of _delete_current_gw_port

Switch to a callback based approach for cleaning up the
distributed resources for a router gateway. This maintains
the current transactional semantics and gets us closer
to eliminating the use of mixins for DVR.

Change-Id: I1d17706652811383d4bc968812d5cd6526febc4b

subject: Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 06:12:25.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/evaluator/actions/evaluator_event_transformer.py'], 'message': 'Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659
(cherry picked from commit 2125293)
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659
(cherry picked from commit 2125293)

subject: Don't process/queue children not matched
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 22:59:02.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/build.py'], 'message': "Don't process/queue children not matched

It seems like children that are unmatched are
still submitted onto the queue (and then they
don't do anything) when we can just avoid that
processing in the first place by just not
submitting them in the first place.

(cherry picked from commit ec8e72df7a9b04a3e5977cf23b12ba1fdf8a1f57)

Change-Id: Id33337f36437cbd6f96e6fd5fd20723e03273ec2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't process/queue children not matched

It seems like children that are unmatched are
still submitted onto the queue (and then they
don't do anything) when we can just avoid that
processing in the first place by just not
submitting them in the first place.

(cherry picked from commit ec8e72df7a9b04a3e5977cf23b12ba1fdf8a1f57)

Change-Id: Id33337f36437cbd6f96e6fd5fd20723e03273ec2

In protection service, both protect and restore operation
use user token passed by context to create clients of other
openstack services and access them by that client. It may

Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
'}]
commit_message:
Spec: Refactor the clients used in protect service

In protection service, both protect and restore operation
use user token passed by context to create clients of other
openstack services and access them by that client. It may
fail to access other services because of the expiration of
user token.

Change-Id: I5279d9b690b2fed0cafb604844555b8b6408b077
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients

Closes-Bug: #1628606

commit_message:
Update instance host and task state when post live migration fails

If a live migration fails during the post processing it can lead to
the instance being shutdown on the source node and left in a migrating
task state. The instance is now running on the target node so the
instance host and task state should be updated.

Change-Id: I65c81559c7cbd94094de6f3dd6c8e761de1cb15c
Closes-Bug: #1628606

commit_message:
[microversion] Bump to 2.39

microversion v2.39 will change the response code of os-migrateLive,
this patch adds supports to that changes.

os-migrateLive will will not alway return a 409 response code when an
attempt is made to live migrate an instance in a rescued state.

Change-Id: I944a5b831ab102d080462af7850629a4d1692cf7
Depends-on: Ie1fc20fe5e028dd53116d5549814442232ddfe49
Implements: blueprint live-migrate-rescued-instances

subject: Change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-04 15:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/services/triggers.py'], 'message': 'Change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: I7aeb4998769d8210456f22df465ebfea63eef50d
Closes-Bug: #1592164
'}]
commit_message:
Change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: I7aeb4998769d8210456f22df465ebfea63eef50d
Closes-Bug: #1592164

commit_message:
DON'T MERGE: add asssertion for get spec

I'm still wondering why we didn't catch a memory leak[1] in the gate
even though we have the test and I got the failure in local machine.

For now, I'm doubting if the gate does nothing due to a lack of
available testing backend and this patch is for asserting that.

Change-Id: I543cb087f660bc5805d98e264c18e49c3c263e46
1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/pyeclib/+bug/1634006

commit_message:
Change exception type for profile type not found

When a profile type specified is not found from the registry, we should
raise ResourceNotFound exception instead of SpecValidationFailed.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-23 14:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/dummy.py'], 'message': '[Dummy driver] Add possibility to set delays for driver methods

Dummy driver was designed to test manila main functionality that is
storage-agnostic. So, add possibility to set delays for each dummy share driver
method, to be able to simulate storage more correctly by having time delays
similar to real storage-drivers.

Two new config options were added:
- dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay (float)
- dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays (dict of string-keys and int/float values)

Configuration example:

[DEFAULT]
enabled_share_backends = fake_backend_name

[fake_backend_name]
...
dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay = 2.0
dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays = create_share:5.15,delete_share:1
...

Change-Id: I36598f74762f3631c6c8502148ea9989ad544b5a
'}]
commit_message:
[Dummy driver] Add possibility to set delays for driver methods

Dummy driver was designed to test manila main functionality that is
storage-agnostic. So, add possibility to set delays for each dummy share driver
method, to be able to simulate storage more correctly by having time delays
similar to real storage-drivers.

Two new config options were added:
- dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay (float)
- dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays (dict of string-keys and int/float values)

Configuration example:

[DEFAULT]
enabled_share_backends = fake_backend_name

[fake_backend_name]
...
dummy_driver_default_driver_method_delay = 2.0
dummy_driver_driver_methods_delays = create_share:5.15,delete_share:1
...

Change-Id: I36598f74762f3631c6c8502148ea9989ad544b5a

subject: Refactor, add encrypt/decrypt data dict functions to crypt
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-11-29 20:26:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/crypt.py', 'heat/tests/test_crypt.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py'], 'message': 'Refactor, add encrypt/decrypt data dict functions to crypt

Just a refactor, no change in functionality.

The functions added to crypt are used to encrypt / decrypt resource
properties data dicts. Note that they should not be used for
encrypting / decrypting other things such as params or user creds
(which are just strings).  An intermediate json conversion of each
value in a dict takes place before it is encrypted/decrypted.

Change-Id: Id6bcc90cbf430095719315ac7e9d3e8c9e745012
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor, add encrypt/decrypt data dict functions to crypt

Just a refactor, no change in functionality.

The functions added to crypt are used to encrypt / decrypt resource
properties data dicts. Note that they should not be used for
encrypting / decrypting other things such as params or user creds
(which are just strings).  An intermediate json conversion of each
value in a dict takes place before it is encrypted/decrypted.

Change-Id: Id6bcc90cbf430095719315ac7e9d3e8c9e745012

commit_message:
IPAM: lower log level if subnet does not exist

There are cases when a subnet does not exist and a relevant
exception is raised. When running Rally tests these log
messages litter the log files.

Lower the log leve to debug.

Change-Id: I4bdde86adc8d6919cedf6488b19aa525cfe7f782
Closes-bug: #1644739

subject: ITRI DISCO cinder volume driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 03:55:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/releasenotes/notes/refactor-disco-volume-driver-2e4a640c9803a49e.yaml'], 'message': 'ITRI DISCO cinder volume driver

This commit is the refactored version of DISCO volume driver of ITRI.

We change the SOAP API to REST API. It adds also two different classes:

* Class for the different calls using REST API
* Class for attach/detach a DISCO volume

It also includes the unit tests.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint refactor-disco-volume-driver

Change-Id: I786f15efbc6a1b6fd89016cefa0b55c5997aeb44
'}]
commit_message:
ITRI DISCO cinder volume driver

This commit is the refactored version of DISCO volume driver of ITRI.

We change the SOAP API to REST API. It adds also two different classes:

* Class for the different calls using REST API
* Class for attach/detach a DISCO volume

It also includes the unit tests.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint refactor-disco-volume-driver

Change-Id: I786f15efbc6a1b6fd89016cefa0b55c5997aeb44

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-24 04:30:29.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/common/utils.py', 'searchlight/service_policies.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/swift/__init__.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/common/wsgi.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin.py', 'searchlight/cmd/manage.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/mock_glance_pyclient.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/__init__.py', 'searchlight/listener.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/cinder/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/utils.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_swift_account_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/metadefs_notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_swift_container_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_image_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_api.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_glance_plugins.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/helper.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I26b94d5c06ebcc7acecdbb1aa403fa0aad5e6626
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I26b94d5c06ebcc7acecdbb1aa403fa0aad5e6626

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-19 00:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/common/wsgi.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/neutron/notification_handlers.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I0b8b40e067ac26275c2a0f165f4c6b04e7f921a5
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I0b8b40e067ac26275c2a0f165f4c6b04e7f921a5

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-02 05:06:23.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Install neutron-lbaas plugin in neutron-server container

To include the neutron-lbaas sources in the neutron-base container when
using the type source it is required to add the neutron-lbaas sources
as a plugin for the neutron-server container.

Closes-bug: #1592418

commit_message:
Install neutron-lbaas plugin in neutron-server container

To include the neutron-lbaas sources in the neutron-base container when
using the type source it is required to add the neutron-lbaas sources
as a plugin for the neutron-server container.

Change-Id: If65c631421f47bfa9dd58cd15266aee722b4fdc8
Closes-bug: #1592418

commit_message:
Grant Compute user write permission  to Glance images pool

Nova has implemented instance rbd snapshot feature to reduce snapshot
time, to use this feature, Nova requires write permission to Glance
images pool.

Closes-Bug: #1641815

Change-Id: I0d57d3fb352c68309432084c68d1d24e4f6ce8b6

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-29 00:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['fuxi/volumeprovider/cinder.py', 'fuxi/tests/volumeprovider/test_cinder.py'], 'message': 'Retrieve volumes from cinder with matched metadata

For fuxi, it should retrieves volumes from Cinder which as long as
have matched metadata(link {"volume_from": "fuxi"}) when Docker
executes cmd  'docker volume ls'.
For condition 'or not vol.attachment', it means that volume must
be attached at least one host, so that Fuxi could recognize it,
so revome this condition.

Change-Id: Ie73ebc301d51d33cbce924121ce6971761177542
Closes-Bug: #1636365
'}]
commit_message:
Retrieve volumes from cinder with matched metadata

For fuxi, it should retrieves volumes from Cinder which as long as
have matched metadata(link {"volume_from": "fuxi"}) when Docker
executes cmd  'docker volume ls'.
For condition 'or not vol.attachment', it means that volume must
be attached at least one host, so that Fuxi could recognize it,
so revome this condition.

Change-Id: Ie73ebc301d51d33cbce924121ce6971761177542
Closes-Bug: #1636365

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-25 02:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/common/net_helpers.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'fullstack: add some more security group tests

The added tests check if a remote SG member addition works and
a SG rule removal stops an established connection.  These tests
piggyback on the existing test method in order to work around
the lack of isolation between tests.

Change-Id: I43bae9b320528ecdf3ec60881613ab1028e90144
'}]
commit_message:
fullstack: add some more security group tests

The added tests check if a remote SG member addition works and
a SG rule removal stops an established connection.  These tests
piggyback on the existing test method in order to work around
the lack of isolation between tests.

Change-Id: I43bae9b320528ecdf3ec60881613ab1028e90144

in Python 3 [1], use LOG.warning instead.

commit_message:
[hacking] Ensure not to use LOG.warn

This patchs ensures not to use LOG.warn because LOG.warn deprecated
in Python 3 [1], use LOG.warning instead.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I50e44a89092e0ee15f5be294837a87c321427921

commit_message:
Add optional neutron rpc driver support

This patch provides a configuration option to use network services
over rpc channel and rpc client support.
rpc server side changes are submitted in Kuryr repo.
All neutron communicating utilities will remain in common kuryr repo.

Related patchset in Kuryr repo:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340147/

Partially implements blueprint rpc-and-tagging-support
Change-Id: Ia6ddd11b1c8f9252b319e6c69e945fa9a6bb4bdd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 22:56:51.000000000', 'files': ['firstboot/os-net-config-mappings.yaml'], 'message': 'No longer hard coding to a specifc network interface name.

Instead of using a specific network interface name, thi fix
fetch all ethernet mac addresses. Then uses this list of
mac addresses to do a check if any entries in the list
match any of the values in NetConfigDataLookup for a node.
If there is a match, the /etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml
file for the node will be written.

This fix removes the hard coded interface name 'eth0' used
to get a mac address as identifyer for the specific node
before. Using a hard coded interface name such as 'eth0'
would have failed on most hardware because of "consistent
network device names".

    Fix Bug: #1642551

Change-Id: I6c1d1b4d70b916bc5d9049469df8221f8ab2eb95
'}]
commit_message:
No longer hard coding to a specifc network interface name.

Instead of using a specific network interface name, thi fix
fetch all ethernet mac addresses. Then uses this list of
mac addresses to do a check if any entries in the list
match any of the values in NetConfigDataLookup for a node.
If there is a match, the /etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml
file for the node will be written.

This fix removes the hard coded interface name 'eth0' used
to get a mac address as identifyer for the specific node
before. Using a hard coded interface name such as 'eth0'
would have failed on most hardware because of "consistent
network device names".

    Fix Bug: #1642551

Change-Id: I6c1d1b4d70b916bc5d9049469df8221f8ab2eb95

[{'number': 42, 'created': '2016-11-25 16:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_rpcapi.py', 'releasenotes/notes/cluster_job_distribution-f916dd2e4cce6c1b.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Support A/A in attach/detach operations

This patch allows attaching and detaching volumes in HA Active-Active
configurations.

To allow the attach and detach of volumes in Cinder using the cluster
topic queue in the Message Broker following RPC methods in
cinder/volume/rpcapi has been changed:

- attach_volume
- detach_volume
- initialize_connection
- terminate_connection
- remove_export

When the cluster field is not set for a volume all RPC calls will behave
as before, sending it to the host topic queue.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I6ec689ea8abb10832a47b20f82bf2e710c62deae
'}]
commit_message:
Support A/A in attach/detach operations

This patch allows attaching and detaching volumes in HA Active-Active
configurations.

To allow the attach and detach of volumes in Cinder using the cluster
topic queue in the Message Broker following RPC methods in
cinder/volume/rpcapi has been changed:

- attach_volume
- detach_volume
- initialize_connection
- terminate_connection
- remove_export

When the cluster field is not set for a volume all RPC calls will behave
as before, sending it to the host topic queue.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I6ec689ea8abb10832a47b20f82bf2e710c62deae

Some distros ship with /etc/samba/smb.conf already in

commit_message:
Fix devstack smb configuration outside ubuntu

Some distros ship with /etc/samba/smb.conf already in
place, without /usr/share/samba/smb.conf.

Only copy /etc/samba/smb.conf from /usr/share/samba/smb.conf
if /usr/share/samba/smb.conf exists.

Change-Id: I22aeed317a94774ff03c1aadf6a65f5edb490837
Fixes-bug: 1645860

commit_message:
Update network dict with segment and mtu info in _create_subnet_db

Without this, the mech driver create_submit_(pre/post)commit functions
when called will not have segment and network mtu information in
context.network.current.

Change-Id: I3214a19e2374221b211ac7ab9b98842a1bdfc4a7
Closes-bug: #1644519

commit_message:
Remove _is_true() from test_volumes_actions.py

This commit removes the _is_true() function. Because APIs should be
stable, so we shouldn't need like this function for normalizing values.
Otherwise, API users also need something like that function.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-24 12:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py'], 'message': 'Capture NotFound Exceptions in subnet postcommit

Change I28323eddcf34fd12002cc706f4a9bcbb3f976ceb introduced
a subtle difference in the types of exceptions that can be
encountered during the operations after creating a subnet.

Before that change, a giant enclosing transaction would provide
REPEATABLE READ guarantees, so once a port was looked up by
IPAM, calling update_port on that port afterwards in the same
transaction would not result in a PortNotFound exception.
The same applied to looking up a router and then updating its
gateway port.

Now that there is no giant enclosing transaction, we have to
capture the possible PortNotFound and RouterNotFound exceptions
that can occur during these post commit subnet create operations.

Closes-Bug: #1644502
Change-Id: I29e2bf7bcda37ebbcee193f94c8b03df90f24ef1
'}]
commit_message:
Capture NotFound Exceptions in subnet postcommit

Change I28323eddcf34fd12002cc706f4a9bcbb3f976ceb introduced
a subtle difference in the types of exceptions that can be
encountered during the operations after creating a subnet.

Before that change, a giant enclosing transaction would provide
REPEATABLE READ guarantees, so once a port was looked up by
IPAM, calling update_port on that port afterwards in the same
transaction would not result in a PortNotFound exception.
The same applied to looking up a router and then updating its
gateway port.

Now that there is no giant enclosing transaction, we have to
capture the possible PortNotFound and RouterNotFound exceptions
that can occur during these post commit subnet create operations.

Closes-Bug: #1644502
Change-Id: I29e2bf7bcda37ebbcee193f94c8b03df90f24ef1

commit_message:
Revert "DHCP agent: advertise SLAAC prefixes"

This reverts commit 11c3f0cafd62f9f9b46fd494f9cc6c372f77b1c9.

This patch broke all CentOS installations that ship dnsmasq 2.66 that
does not support --ra-param CLI argument.

Change-Id: I1919f9d3af40bb2f10693420ae08e1ec62accb65
Closes-Bug: #1644312

commit_message:
Add chassis in db_store

To use virtual tunnel port in applications, the IP address of remote
chassis is needed to apply it in the OpenFlow. Adding it to db store
can avoid retrieving it from nb db everytime.

Change-Id: Ia558daee18f09a4f652d6041c7323e439d704730
Partially-implements: blueprint virtual-tunnel-port-support

subject: Have ZMQ send values in pub/sub events
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-04 08:02:38.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/pubsub_drivers/zmq_pubsub_driver.py'], 'message': 'Have ZMQ send values in pub/sub events

Previously we have had ZMQ remove the values in pub/sub events, and read
the values from the NB DB upon event reception. This was done to prevent
data inconsistency in case of race conditions.

This issue has been mitigated with versioning and DB consistency. So
this is no longer necessary. However, to maintain this functionality, a
configuration option has been added (default False, i.e. the default is
the new behaviour).

Change-Id: I0e629a8c56d01510903045b0c0ee15b48130a956
'}]
commit_message:
Have ZMQ send values in pub/sub events

Previously we have had ZMQ remove the values in pub/sub events, and read
the values from the NB DB upon event reception. This was done to prevent
data inconsistency in case of race conditions.

This issue has been mitigated with versioning and DB consistency. So
this is no longer necessary. However, to maintain this functionality, a
configuration option has been added (default False, i.e. the default is
the new behaviour).

Change-Id: I0e629a8c56d01510903045b0c0ee15b48130a956

commit_message:
ml2: Restore provider attributes for create_subnet

A recent change [1] removed provider network related
attributes in network for create_subnet SubnetContext.
This commit restores the attributes because one of them
(network_type) is used by midonet mech driver at least.

[1] I28323eddcf34fd12002cc706f4a9bcbb3f976ceb

Closes-Bug: #1644486
Change-Id: I4fd8adc5a95544e4c21cc268223da9143b1ef610

subject: Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 17:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/evaluator/actions/evaluator_event_transformer.py'], 'message': 'Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: When creating a vertex by the evaluator transformer, take only parameters that are not None. Otherwise, a None parameter may overwrite a "real" parameter that already exists on the vertex.

An example:
In case there are two actions on a host: set-state to ERROR and mark-down.
The first vertex update is: vitrage_state=ERROR, is_marked_down=None
The second vertex update is: vitrage_state=None, is_marked_down=True

The second vertex update replaces the ERROR state to with None.
My fix removes the None, so the ERROR state remains as is.

Change-Id: If523bb9c06bcd3bd289f4de956fe737fc573a2da
Closes-Bug: #1645659

commit_message:
[api-ref] Correct status code of backup delete

Current doc states "Error repsonse codes:204". This should actually
by "Normal response code" and be 202 (Accepted) vs 204 (No Content).

Change-Id: I6e3855b2d1280de3e0fe6b5638feb54e9dfa4c10
Closes-bug: #1598237

Add `specs` target to README.rst

In README.rst, there is a missing link for the `specs` target
that cause a lint error when executing: rst-lint README.rst.
This patch set addresses this issue by adding the appropriate
spec link in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1645280

subject: Pre Deploy ExtraConfig to install additiona puppet modules.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-24 09:36:23.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/extra-puppet-modules-from-forge-repo/extra-puppet-modules-from-forge-repo.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/extra-puppet-modules-from-forge-repo/environment-extra-puppet-modules-from-forge-repo.yaml'], 'message': 'Pre Deploy ExtraConfig to install additiona puppet modules.

This heat template install additional puppet moduels into
/etc/puppet/modules by execution "puppet module install"
command. A parameter must be used to specify the puppet
repository server to use, e.g Puppet Forge, or other
repository supporting the Forge API.

These puppet modules can then be used by including the
classes in ExtraConfig and role specific friends like this:

   parameter_defaults:
     ExtraConfig:
     compute_classes:
      - ::motd
    control_classes:
      - ::motd

     motd::content: 'Welcome to your overcloud node!/n'

Or a SoftwareConfig/SoftwareDeployment resource may be
used with 'group: puppet' included as NodeExtraConfigPost such
as this:

  heat_template_version: 2014-10-16

  description: >
    Run Puppet extra configuration to configure remote logging

  parameters:
    servers:
      type: json

  resources:
    RsyslogExtraPuppetConfig:
      type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig
      properties:
        group: puppet
        config: |
          class{'rsyslog::client':
            remote_servers => [
              {
                host => 'logs.example.org',
                port => '55514',
              },
              {
                host      => 'logs.somewhere.com',
                port      => '555',
                pattern   => '*.log',
                protocol  => 'tcp',
                format    => 'RFC3164fmt',
              },
            ]
          }
        options:
          enable_hiera: True
          enable_facter: False

    RsyslogExtraPuppetDeployments:
      type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments
      properties:
        config: {get_resource: RsyslogExtraPuppetConfig}
        servers: {get_param: servers}

Change-Id: I71c739d22688b440c757ff3c2da6a62adaa6438b
'}]
commit_message:
Pre Deploy ExtraConfig to install additiona puppet modules.

This heat template install additional puppet moduels into
/etc/puppet/modules by execution "puppet module install"
command. A parameter must be used to specify the puppet
repository server to use, e.g Puppet Forge, or other
repository supporting the Forge API.

These puppet modules can then be used by including the
classes in ExtraConfig and role specific friends like this:

   parameter_defaults:
     ExtraConfig:
     compute_classes:
      - ::motd
    control_classes:
      - ::motd

     motd::content: 'Welcome to your overcloud node!/n'

Or a SoftwareConfig/SoftwareDeployment resource may be
used with 'group: puppet' included as NodeExtraConfigPost such
as this:

  heat_template_version: 2014-10-16

  description: >
    Run Puppet extra configuration to configure remote logging

  parameters:
    servers:
      type: json

  resources:
    RsyslogExtraPuppetConfig:
      type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig
      properties:
        group: puppet
        config: |
          class{'rsyslog::client':
            remote_servers => [
              {
                host => 'logs.example.org',
                port => '55514',
              },
              {
                host      => 'logs.somewhere.com',
                port      => '555',
                pattern   => '*.log',
                protocol  => 'tcp',
                format    => 'RFC3164fmt',
              },
            ]
          }
        options:
          enable_hiera: True
          enable_facter: False

    RsyslogExtraPuppetDeployments:
      type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments
      properties:
        config: {get_resource: RsyslogExtraPuppetConfig}
        servers: {get_param: servers}

Change-Id: I71c739d22688b440c757ff3c2da6a62adaa6438b

commit_message:
Fix import method to follow community guideline

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as community guideline [1].
[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

Change-Id: I96ef4ff0f9e1163fab9a8bedde5323ecc91f4092

commit_message:
placement: adds ResourceClass.save()

Implement the ability to update the name of a custom resource class. We
raise similar exceptions to ResourceClass.destroy() if the user attempts
to modify the name of a standard resource class.

Change-Id: I2365dc48176aa7f1fc19cce4050df21204be0afa
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Add support for OpenStack client

Cloudkittyclient now provides a plugin for the Openstack client.
setup.cfg was modified to provide entrypoints for the Openstack client. These
entrypoints can be found in the different shell_cli.py files.
Python-openstackclient was added to the requirements.

Implements: blueprint openstackclient-support
Change-Id: If0bbd919b1552b82cd77a52ded4f4ec32e6e14d8

Closes-Bug: #1644437

commit_message:
Fix OSprofiler support

During the new OSprofiler initialization method introduction
there was an issue introduced - OSprofiler expects context
to be a dict, not Context object. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I8b42aa47276c6e7ef362cf9ed4501ee732b5cc4b
Closes-Bug: #1644437

subject: Fix Failing tests with openssl >= 1.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-04 05:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/common/cms.py'], 'message': "Fix Failing tests with openssl >= 1.1.0

keystoneclient.tests.unit.test_cms.CMSTest.test_cms_verify
keystoneclient.tests.unit.test_cms.CMSTest.test_cms_verify_token_no_files

failing with: Command 'openssl' returned non-zero exit status 1

I think its OpenSSL >= 1.1 bug, which returns wrong exit code (1 instead of
2) if input file not exists.

Change-Id: I776596487f305c759b88c0d4c604571c33c6ef70
Closes-Bug: #1646858
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Failing tests with openssl >= 1.1.0

keystoneclient.tests.unit.test_cms.CMSTest.test_cms_verify
keystoneclient.tests.unit.test_cms.CMSTest.test_cms_verify_token_no_files

failing with: Command 'openssl' returned non-zero exit status 1

I think its OpenSSL >= 1.1 bug, which returns wrong exit code (1 instead of
2) if input file not exists.

Change-Id: I776596487f305c759b88c0d4c604571c33c6ef70
Closes-Bug: #1646858

Add mechanism to execute JavaScript test

Same as other UI plugins, it can run tests by the following command.
npm run test

Change-Id: I5bf05b9b8b073b805844496a73670fd62c791160

The next two patches are being temporarily reverted as

we should revert this temporarily in order to avoid

Revert "DB: use get_unique_keys from oslo_db"

This reverts commit cf6917f462189202d00060b9c6eb5f73a11a2ed9.

Revert "DB: remove deprecation warnings for BASEV2"

Change-Id: I5d749bebb2ae5930ab6afed5065c9803caee8165
'}]
commit_message:
Squash revert to breaking changes

The next two patches are being temporarily reverted as
they broke a number of subprojects. Breakages were not
thoughtfully elaborated and not communicated, and that
is rude.

Granted deprecations messages were in place, and that's
yet another examples why deprecations are ineffective at
preventing breakages.

Since we landed another breaking change round about the
same time (plugin-directory) in order to restore sanity
we should revert this temporarily in order to avoid
cramming fixes down the gate.

Revert "DB: use get_unique_keys from oslo_db"

This reverts commit cf6917f462189202d00060b9c6eb5f73a11a2ed9.

Revert "DB: remove deprecation warnings for BASEV2"

This reverts commit 3b8143bf2d9e95585ec426ffb4e91ba4d7c05107.

Change-Id: I5d749bebb2ae5930ab6afed5065c9803caee8165

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-29 19:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/test_access.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1626523-migration-rw-access-fix-7da3365c7b5b90a1.yaml', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_migration.py', 'manila/share/access.py', 'manila/share/migration.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix share writable in host-assisted migration

For drivers that implement update_access always through recovery
mode, access rules previously set to read-only were being reset
to read-write when the Data Service was adding/removing its access
rule.

Fixed it by integrating the logic that casts DB rules to read-only

Change-Id: Ife35dcdb99dffa2f266b5c2f6a68fe163da7edd3
Closes-bug: #1626523
'}]
commit_message:
Fix share writable in host-assisted migration

For drivers that implement update_access always through recovery
mode, access rules previously set to read-only were being reset
to read-write when the Data Service was adding/removing its access
rule.

Fixed it by integrating the logic that casts DB rules to read-only
into access helper class.

Change-Id: Ife35dcdb99dffa2f266b5c2f6a68fe163da7edd3
Closes-bug: #1626523

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/22ca58fc1da674b1edf6e0a9ce2f2aa2

Change-Id: I6d4e6ce241a70ec056c5fddb574b3efa988fc506

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 09:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Always allow to create snapshot db record with snapshot-manage

Now, Cinder will raise 400 error when users manage a snapshot if
the volume is in-use. We should allow this action in this situation.
So set the "force=True" here when create the snapshot db record.

Change-Id: Ic85ca0ec35a1711ecad6f08432b301ec1f82d6f2
Closes-bug: #1534350
'}]
commit_message:
Always allow to create snapshot db record with snapshot-manage

Now, Cinder will raise 400 error when users manage a snapshot if
the volume is in-use. We should allow this action in this situation.
So set the "force=True" here when create the snapshot db record.

Change-Id: Ic85ca0ec35a1711ecad6f08432b301ec1f82d6f2
Closes-bug: #1534350

commit_message:
Remove unused pacemaker profiles

With the landing of HA NG in Newton we can actually remove the
pacemaker profiles we do not need. The only ones that are being
used in one form or the other are:

$ grep -ir services\/pacemaker environments | awk '{ print $3 }' | sort | uniq
../puppet/services/pacemaker/cinder-backup.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/database/mysql.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/database/redis.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/manila-share.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml
../puppet/services/pacemaker.yaml

The only exception is profile/pacemaker/database/mongodbvalidator
because it is included by profile/base/database/mongodb.pp

Change-Id: I80c8559bb2d915385bcc20ae71fe144ddd6591c1

commit_message:
Add verify required and CA bundle to haproxy

This only takes effect is internal-tls is used, and forces haproxy to
do proper verifications of the SSL certificates provided by the
servers.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: Ibd98ec46dd6570887db29f55fe183deb1c9dc642

revisions:

Heat used to accept either stack name or id

Scale nodes in the documentation and in the argparse usage
states that stacks can be identified by name or id but mistral
only accepts stack names.

commit_message:
Use stack name or id for backwards compatibility

Heat used to accept either stack name or id

Scale nodes in the documentation and in the argparse usage
states that stacks can be identified by name or id but mistral
only accepts stack names.

This makes the client accept names or ids and pass names for the
mistral workflow

Change-Id: If7527e36c1e5d2214dc155392a2e3750b38ec365
Closes-Bug: #1640933
(cherry picked from commit a3012ca424747ae815ed0b72184fa465765ccb9a)

commit_message:
Format the nodes list in openstack overcloud delete node

The current command will output something like the following:

  deleting nodes [u'UUID-UUID'] from stack overcloud

This change adds simple string formatting so that a raw Python list
isn't displayed.

Change-Id: Ibf8bc40f0c45be60e869c5ab3d99d892e24f8a94
Closes-Bug: #1633449
(cherry picked from commit 2cc4eef66060bf4fc4071c2368b59fe4df7ace14)

subject: Give better output on scale failures
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 12:30:13.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/scale.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_node/test_overcloud_node.py'], 'message': "Give better output on scale failures

Currently when there's a failure during scale the output is
pprinted json that is confusing and uninstrutive

Printing the return message message attribute gives all the important
status needed from that json

Partial-Bug: #1640933
(cherry picked from commit 37a4a6f6ae16b26eb0e99086ffedb1011355847b)
"}]
commit_message:
Give better output on scale failures

Currently when there's a failure during scale the output is
pprinted json that is confusing and uninstrutive

Printing the return message message attribute gives all the important
status needed from that json

Change-Id: I6e81f5812895f50209d1dc7a35c4f8fbd2447926
Partial-Bug: #1640933
(cherry picked from commit 37a4a6f6ae16b26eb0e99086ffedb1011355847b)

commit_message:
Refactoring config options for mech_sriov opts

Refactoring neutron ml2 plugin mech_sriov config opts to be in
neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov so that all the
configuration options for mech_sriov reside in a centralized
location. This simplifies the process of looking up the mech_sriov
config opts and provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: I64b243f91f2e637279456b3b06c2998cd89dc076
Partial-Bug: #1563069

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-02 06:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/validator.py', 'templates/net-config.json.template', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_validator.py'], 'message': "Add option to set undercloud dns nameserver

This adds an undercloud_nameserver option which will be taken into
account in os-net-config to set up the undercloud's nameserver. If left
unset, it will give an empty list to the dns_servers parameter in
os-net-config, which will actually do nothing. If set, it will use that
nameserver as the sole member of a list that is passed to the
aforementioned parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2b8a3f64dc1958f00b0471b68ba8283da76a4e7b
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to set undercloud dns nameserver

This adds an undercloud_nameserver option which will be taken into
account in os-net-config to set up the undercloud's nameserver. If left
unset, it will give an empty list to the dns_servers parameter in
os-net-config, which will actually do nothing. If set, it will use that
nameserver as the sole member of a list that is passed to the
aforementioned parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2b8a3f64dc1958f00b0471b68ba8283da76a4e7b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-03 15:47:55.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove zesty series metadata

The charm store does not yet recognize this series, and errors
when it exists, thereby preventing push/release of dev charms
into the charm store.

commit_message:
Remove zesty series metadata

The charm store does not yet recognize this series, and errors
when it exists, thereby preventing push/release of dev charms
into the charm store.

Revisit after the following is resolved:

 - https://github.com/juju/charmstore/issues/695

Change-Id: I5985113b95f28f61555e22a9c522afd6bce23591

commit_message:
Add a test for attaching 2 volumes to a server

In Newton development, we could not attach multiple volumes to a
single server. That seemed critical bug and it is good to block
such changes in the future.

Change-Id: Icdeafb5f30159205c89cb76a8d38399cefcb6127
Closes-Bug: #1633535

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-23 16:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/quota_enforcement.py', 'neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_hooks.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/v2/test_attributes.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/resource.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/startup.py'], 'message': "Remove REVERSED_PLURALS and get_resource_info()

By changing pecan to store plugins by collection (plural) instead of
resource (singular) we don't need REVERSED_PLURALS and
get_resource_info().

These are not used outside of neutron core.

Consequently, this exposed a bug with some controllers not honoring an
extension's intention of disallowing pagination and sorting.  This is
also fixed in this patch to get successful test runs.

Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I9d529d0a2ad369e2be0a8df3c6f06a6532e8b13d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove REVERSED_PLURALS and get_resource_info()

By changing pecan to store plugins by collection (plural) instead of
resource (singular) we don't need REVERSED_PLURALS and
get_resource_info().

These are not used outside of neutron core.

Consequently, this exposed a bug with some controllers not honoring an
extension's intention of disallowing pagination and sorting.  This is
also fixed in this patch to get successful test runs.

Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I9d529d0a2ad369e2be0a8df3c6f06a6532e8b13d

commit_message:
Fix InvalidInput exception output

Ensure that only one period ends the data. The exception adds the
period so no need to pass the error_message with a period.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I411534fc7ea56946a72890808154cc43ba3b6c1d
Closes-bug: #1618881

commit_message:
Add unit tests for doctor's caching symptoms

Currently there are no unit tests for any of doctors symptoms. This
patch is only adding unit tests for the caching symptoms and more
will be released for each symptom group in doctor.

Change-Id: I177ef91206bcad095be06b0607c04c1547994146
Partial-Bug: #1641621

commit_message:
Return correct response codes

Following apis are returning incorrect response codes but according
to api-guidelines [1] they should return following responses:

    POST: notification create:
          old_response: 200, new_response: 202
    DELETE: notification delete:
          old_response: 404, new_response: 405
    PUT: notification update:
          old_response: 404, new_response: 405
    POST: Host create:
          old_response: 200, new_response: 201
    DELETE: Host delete:
          old_response: 200, new_response: 204
    POST: Failover-segment create:
          old_response: 200, new_response: 201
    DELETE: Failover-segment delete:
          old_response: 200, new_response: 204

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/http.html#failure-code-clarifications

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1645699
Change-Id: Ia4569d61bdebba9f8778dd1c09a8334d5b76096b

commit_message:
Deal with CONF.config_dir correctly

When config_dir is set, we were seeing this error:
  execv() arg 2 must contain only strings

We got this debug log:
  ['sudo', 'nova-rootwrap', ... ,
  '--config-file', '/nova/nova.conf', '--config-dir', ['/etc/nova'],
  ...]

Change-Id: I592035f7e37adee375f1530d4fbc28107870b089
Closes-Bug: 1616240

commit_message:
Revert "Fix file permissions"

This reverts commit eb14f66d392b61fb81d6c8e51526f16aa841f571.

Turned out that fullstack uses those files to start services, instead of
relying on console scripts generated by pbr. So without those files
having +x permissions, fullstack tests using those agents completely
fail.

Change-Id: I14f98fdd244ecfedfa97fb31bff9763a49e5cfb0

commit_message:
Allow security_groups to be a scalar

novaclient requires a list. If a user does not provide a list, wrap
their value in a list for them. Otherwise nova tries to treat the string
as a list which, you know, doens't work.

Change-Id: Iadbf81c23a87a4e2fa32616b0737b2cfc67e9718

'doc/source/devref/service_extensions.rst', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/startup.py'], 'message': 'Adopt neutron-lib plugin directory

Neutron Manager is loaded at the very startup of the neutron
server process and with it plugins are loaded and stored for

this patch refactors the code so that these references are held
by a plugin directory.

to use the directory in lieu of the manager. The result is a
leaner, cleaner, and more decoupled code.

Usage pattern [1,2] can be translated to [3,4] respectively.

[1] manager.NeutronManager.get_service_plugins()[FOO]
[2] manager.NeutronManager.get_plugin()
[3] directory.get_plugin(FOO)
[4] directory.get_plugin()

The more entangled part is in the neutron unit tests, where the
use of the manager can be simplified as mocking is typically
replaced by a call to the directory add_plugin() method. This is
safe as each test case gets its own copy of the plugin directory.
That said, unit tests that look more like API tests and that rely on
the entire plugin machinery, need some tweaking to avoid stumbling
into plugin loading failures.

Due to the massive use of the manager, deprecation warnings are
considered impractical as they cause logs to bloat out of proportion.

Follow-up patches that show how to adopt the directory in neutron
subprojects are tagged with topic:plugin-directory.

NeutronLibImpact

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I7331e914234c5f0b7abe836604fdd7e4067551cf
'}]
commit_message:
Adopt neutron-lib plugin directory

Neutron Manager is loaded at the very startup of the neutron
server process and with it plugins are loaded and stored for
lookup purposes as their references are widely used across the
entire neutron codebase.

Rather than holding these references directly in NeutronManager
this patch refactors the code so that these references are held
by a plugin directory.

This allows subprojects and other parts of the Neutron codebase
to use the directory in lieu of the manager. The result is a
leaner, cleaner, and more decoupled code.

Usage pattern [1,2] can be translated to [3,4] respectively.

[1] manager.NeutronManager.get_service_plugins()[FOO]
[2] manager.NeutronManager.get_plugin()
[3] directory.get_plugin(FOO)
[4] directory.get_plugin()

The more entangled part is in the neutron unit tests, where the
use of the manager can be simplified as mocking is typically
replaced by a call to the directory add_plugin() method. This is
safe as each test case gets its own copy of the plugin directory.
That said, unit tests that look more like API tests and that rely on
the entire plugin machinery, need some tweaking to avoid stumbling
into plugin loading failures.

Due to the massive use of the manager, deprecation warnings are
considered impractical as they cause logs to bloat out of proportion.

Follow-up patches that show how to adopt the directory in neutron
subprojects are tagged with topic:plugin-directory.

NeutronLibImpact

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I7331e914234c5f0b7abe836604fdd7e4067551cf

subject: Start using requests-mock for REST unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-16 18:20:59.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/fixtures/discovery.json', 'test-requirements.txt', 'shade/tests/unit/fixtures/image-version.json', 'shade/tests/unit/fixtures/catalog.json', 'shade/tests/unit/test_image.py', 'shade/tests/unit/base.py'], 'message': "Start using requests-mock for REST unit tests

Mocking out the whole client is the wrong level. Although we'd still
like to betamax the functional tests - as we put in REST calls, let's
make the mocking of them happen at the requests level so that we test as
much of shade as we can.

Nobody look at the v2 keystone catalog. The existing clouds.yaml entry
was for a v2 cloud and I wanted to keep the patch contained to the task
at hand. We should likely do some crazy testscenarios magic at some
point to make sure _all_ the things work with both v2 and v3.

Change-Id: Ife4d95df5417d329195c737814e89d1370a0597b
"}]
commit_message:
Start using requests-mock for REST unit tests

Mocking out the whole client is the wrong level. Although we'd still
like to betamax the functional tests - as we put in REST calls, let's
make the mocking of them happen at the requests level so that we test as
much of shade as we can.

Nobody look at the v2 keystone catalog. The existing clouds.yaml entry
was for a v2 cloud and I wanted to keep the patch contained to the task
at hand. We should likely do some crazy testscenarios magic at some
point to make sure _all_ the things work with both v2 and v3.

Change-Id: Ife4d95df5417d329195c737814e89d1370a0597b

commit_message:
Add compute instance ID and volume ID to trove show output

The Compute ID (server_id) and Volume ID (volume_id)
associated with a trove instance are useful information
for an administrator. This commit add these fields to the
trove show output. They will only be visible to users
with admin rights.

Change-Id: I4a39b59ae610803f5aaf849f2e20ebb6e4ea1565
Closes-Bug: 1633581

neutron entirely.

Tested with the demo tenant as well and it still
puts on a network without using the --nic parameter, the

commit_message:
(fix troveclient gate) Use alt-demo network

This change uses the alt-demo network instead of sharing
the private network from the demo tenant.  This should
fix the tempest tests on python-troveclient complaining
about this and also brings us one step closer to using
neutron entirely.

Tested with the demo tenant as well and it still
puts on a network without using the --nic parameter, the
only drawback is that the ip doesn't appear on the trove
show command.

The scenario and api tests were modified to always pass
in the nic parameter (as it probably should have been done
from the beginning anyways).

Change-Id: I9f3cbae3490e9995ba5f835fc2304442b83464e4
Closes-Bug: 1647001
